main event: On 15 January 1953, a visual observation of one unidentified flying object was reported over Sonoma, California.
interesting points: The object made approximately 1,500 turns with intervals of 30Â° turns during observation., The estimated speed of the object was about four times that of normal aircraft., The object was observed to perform rapid maneuvers and change altitude, reaching an estimated height of 60,000 feet., No radar pickup was recorded for the object despite visual confirmation by multiple witnesses., The sighting was reported by a retired observer with significant air experience and time in military channels.
